title: Senior Account Manager
content:
We are a team. We are accountable. We partner with our clients to deliver strategic creative we are proud of.
We learn together, we create together, we win together.
And most importantly we have fun together.
 
About the Role:
We’re looking for a Senior Account Manager who is inspired by creative opportunities, and has the passion to help bring these opportunities to life for their clients.
By joining our team, you’ll gain access to:

National/multi-national brands, with impressive creative opportunities
Industry-leading minds across strategy, creative and account service
A well-staffed account service department, 8+ in immediate client team

The account is fast-paced, expands across multiple touch points in each campaign and is packed with growth opportunities. You will be immersed deeply in the business and will support across a range of projects, spanning brand through to digital, all connecting back to solving business challenges.
 
Key Responsibilities: 

Support the Group Account Director and Account Director in daily tasks and interactions with the client
Handle day-to-day administration of the account, including internal and client WIPs, workflow control, meetings, minutes, estimates, and records, under the direction of the Account Director
Manage in an appropriate manner and keep the team informed on work in progress, recognising issues early and pre-empting them
Develop a thorough understanding of the client’s brand and its competitive environment
Write briefs under the supervision of the Account Director
Work with internal stakeholders to get things done on time, on budget, and at the right quality, including peers across departments and disciplines
Ensure clients are efficiently charged for the work the agency has performed
Develop a strong relationship with the client and ensure they are kept in the loop with work in progress. Provide excellent customer service in all client interactions
Actively identify/develop additional business opportunities within assigned clients

 
Required Skills and Experience:

Experience in account management within a creative agency
Proven track record of both leading jobs and providing senior support
Account Management knowledge and experience in digital, social and motion production is preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong presentation abilities, including effective influence/persuasion skills
Negotiation skills and the ability to demonstrate confidence to negotiate costs with suppliers
Strong attention to detail
Ability to relate well to a variety of people and build productive relationships, while still introducing elements of fun and humour in the workplace
Ability to motivate other team members
Ability to handle difficult situation with diplomacy and tact
The ability to approach problem solving in innovative ways to gain the best solution
Strong time management skills and ability to prioritise
Ability to be a good judge of creative work in terms of factual accuracy and relevance to the brief

 
"When people are having fun, they produce better work” – David Ogilvy, Founder.
 
Recent Accolades: 

APAC Effies 2020/21/22: Agency of the Year
APAC Effies 2020/21/22: Agency Network of the Year
2022 Cannes Lion: #1 Creative Network of the Year
Australia’s Most Awarded Agency at Cannes 2022 
Australian Business Awards 2018/19/20/21/22/23: Employer of Choice
Campaign Asia 2019/22: Creative Agency of the Year 
Campaign Asia 2022: Digital Agency of the Year 
Effie Awards 2012/13/16/19: Most Effective Agency Network
LIA AUNZ Regional Agency of the Year

 
Please note: All applicants must have valid Australian working rights.
Ogilvy Australia is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply.
 At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
